Produce final formatted class lists from cleaned student data

Source: R/class_list_functions.R
produce_class_lists.Rd

Aggregates cleaned student, class, and teacher data into a single standardized class list suitable for reporting or export. Each student appears once per school, with their associated class, teacher, and unique identifiers. Default values are used for missing teacher names, and student names are converted to title case.

Usage

produce_class_lists(
  data,
  class_name_column = "ClassName",
  default_teacher = "Reception teacher",
  default_teacher_FN = "Reception",
  default_teacher_SN = "Teacher"
)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing student and class information. Must include at least the columns `SchoolId`, `StudentId`, `SchoolName`, `URN`, the class name column specified by `class_name_column`, and teacher and student name fields such as `TeacherName`, `TeacherForeName`, `TeacherSurName`, `StudentFirstName`, `StudentLastName`, `DoB`, and `UPN`.

class_name_column

Character string specifying the column to use for class names. Default is `"ClassName"`, but `"class_name_use"` is recommended if using `clean_class_names()`.

default_teacher

Character string giving the default main teacher name for records with missing teacher information. Default is `"Reception teacher"`.

default_teacher_FN

Character string giving the default teacher first name. Default is `"Reception"`.

default_teacher_SN

Character string giving the default teacher surname. Default is `"Teacher"`.

Value

A data frame containing one row per student with the following columns:

`School name`

The school name.

`URN`

Unique reference number for the school.

`Class Name`

The class name used in downstream processing.

`Main Teacher Name`

Teacher responsible for the class, with defaults used if missing.

`Pupil First Name`

The student's first name (title-cased).

`Pupil Last Name`

The student's surname (title-cased).

`DoB`

The student's date of birth.

`UPN`

The unique pupil number or ID if available.

`Main Teacher First Name`

The main teacher's first name.

`Main Teacher Last Name`

The main teacher's surname.

Details

This function is typically the final step in the class list processing pipeline, after functions such as `clean_class_names()` and `reduce_to_best_teacher()`. It merges multiple records per student into single entries, applies formatting and default values, and returns a clean, human-readable data frame.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
final_list <- produce_class_lists(
  data = cleaned_data,
  class_name_column = "class_name_use"
)
head(final_list)
} # }
